intro: Pauridia vaginata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Pauridia vaginata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
